alert.note: Alert for East Washington Central Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 17 at 6:44AM PDT until July 17 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...DRY, WINDY CONDITIONS TODAY... .The passage of a dry cold front will promote windy conditions today delivering critical fire conditions to much of central and eastern Washington. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR EAST WASHINGTON CENTRAL CASCADES... * Affected Area: Fire Weather Zone 696 East Washington Central Cascades (Zone 696). * Winds: West 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * Relative Humidities: 20 to 35 percent in the valleys and 30 to 40 percent over the higher terrain. Locally higher humidity values closer to the Cascade Crest. * Impacts: Main concerns for critical fire weather conditions on Monday will be east of the cascade crest. Any new and existing fires have the potential to spread rapidly.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
